events.message: [Qt] Replace shutdown detection poll timer with signal listener

events.body: I think we need to keep the polling-based path as well, to handle UNIX signals?

verification.payload:
tree a8eaf7c3150c1ab88e7a88e656fb73fd45d929e1
parent 9c74b5fe4080b9d24844d516bdbcbc03cc932cd6
author Jonas Schnelli <dev@jonasschnelli.ch> 1492847947 +0200
committer Jonas Schnelli <dev@jonasschnelli.ch> 1492847947 +0200

Respect shutdown signal when handling SIGTERM

events.message: Respect shutdown signal when handling SIGTERM

events.body:
> I think we need to keep the polling-based path as well, to handle UNIX signals?

Not sure. Just added a commit that calls `StartShutdown()` (instead of `fRequestShutdown = true;`).
I guess this should work?

I wasn't aware of the async-signal-safe limitations.
This seems indeed not simply solvable by a signal.
Closing.

comments.body:
This is not a good idea, UNIX signal handlers are extremely limited in what they can do. Basically:
- Set atomic flags
- Send to/receive from pipe

This is why the polling was kept in #10125. It is there *in addition* to notification-based user initiated shutdown.
